title: The Cambridge ancient history.
subject: History, Ancient

contents: v. 1, pt. 1. Prolegomena and prehistory -- v. 1, pt.2. Early history of the Middle East -- v. 2, pt. 1. History of the Middle East and the Aegean region c. 1800-1380 B.C. -- v. 2, pt. 2. History of the Middle East and the Aegean region c. 1380-1000 B.C. -- v. 3, pt. 1. Prehistory of the Balkans, and the Middle East and the Aegean World, tenth to eighth centuries B.C. -- v. 3, pt. 2. Assyrian and Babylonian empires and other states of the Near East, from the eighth through the sixth centuries B.C. -- v. 3, pt. 3. Expansion of the Greek world, eighth to sixth centuries B.C. -- v. 4. Persia, Greece, and the western Mediterranean c. 525 to 479 B.C. (2 pts: [text], plates) -- v. 5. Fifth century B.C. -- v. 6. Fourth century B.C. -- v. 7, pt. 1. Hellenistic world -- v. 7, pt. 2. Rise of Rome to 220 B.C. -- v. 8. Rome and the Mediteranean to 133 B.C. -- v. 9. Last age of the Roman republic, 146-43 B.C. -- v. 10. Augustan Empire, 43 B.C.-A.D. 69 -- v. 11. High empire, A.D. 70-192 -- v. 12. Crisis of empire, A.D. 193-337 -- v. 13 Late empire, A.D. 337-425 -- v. 14. Late antiquity : empire and successors, A.D. 425-600.

lds60: Editions vary: some vols. are 2nd ed., some are 3rd; v. 4 (plates) is new ed.
Individual chapters have already appeared as fascicles, 1961-1968, constituting a major revision of the original edition of The Cambridge ancient history (1923-1939).
"The new edition ... includes two volumes additional to the twelve of the original version"--Pref., v. 13.
ISAW copy (v.7:pt.1) is from the library of Lawrence E. Stager.
ISAW copy (v.3:plates and v.7:pt.1:plates) is from the library of Cornelius and Emily Vermeule.
ISAW copy is from the library of Cornelius and Emily Vermeule.
ISAW copy is from the library of Robert D. Biggs.
ISAW copy is from the library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.
ISAW copy (v.13-14) is from the library of Nina Garsoïan.
